text:
Hi everyone. I am new here and I need some help for my company's new project.

I'm going to follow the structure of my fellow HubSpot newbie above :slightly_smiling_face:

*Context :* 
We want to build a website where our customers can login by SSO with their HubSpot IDs.
This website will include, among other features related to our company business, the capability for users to check their tickets and chats (retrieved via the HubSpot API).

*Question :*
Is it feasible to implement SSO for my customers ? I know it is for HubSpot users (eg our employees), but we need it for our customers and I can't find any ressource in the docs.

Thanks for reading me, I'm looking forward to your answers :pray:

Hey <@U0808CJV5P1> , nice to see that the message structure is catching on :slightly_smiling_face:

I'll attempt to answer your question. It seems to me that since HubSpot is a CRM tool you wont be able to use it as an SSO for your end customers. Only employees can access HubSpot.
Secondly, to integrate SSO with your website try looking into <https://www.keycloak.org/|Keycloak> or something similar.

<@U06PU3Y8CNQ> - for this purpose, CMS Hub Enterprise is functionally the same as Content Hub Enterprise

• The CNAME you need to direct your proxy at would be like: for a HubID = `123456`, the last 2 digits are `56`- that puts this ID in the `<http://sites-proxy.hscoscdn00.net|sites-proxy.hscoscdn00.net>` swimlane and the CNAME is like `<http://123456.sites-proxy.hscoscdn00.net|123456.sites-proxy.hscoscdn00.net>` - perform the same exercise for your specific HubID
That CNAMe doesn't host content, it must be used as the destination/origin of content for the proxy.

Hi everyone, can you share some tips on how you improved your website's performance? In this case, I’m having issues with Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) and Total Blocking Time (TBT). I’ve managed to reduce Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) to 0, but I’m struggling to identify what’s causing the problem with LCP and TBT.

For LCP, the main element is the hero banner, which is fully optimized with srcset image resizing, eager loading for the first element, fetchpriority, etc. If you have any tips or tricks to improve LCP and TBT, please share them. I’d really appreciate it!

<@U0808CJV5P1> - you're looking for a the feature "SSO for private content" or "Memberships". Assuming you have an existing identify provider where your clients login:
• <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/set-up-single-sign-on-sso-to-access-private-content>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/content/memberships/sso>

This might not solve your for your exact use case (hence why you're thinking about building your own), but you can do this already with a HubSpot Customer Portal - <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/inbox/set-up-a-customer-portal>
Retweet to this! I'm struggling with that too!

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hi,

We currently offer a CAD download option on our website, but we encountered limitations in implementing a HubSpot form for this feature. Due to this, we had to rely on a form generated directly from our website’s backend. We're uncertain if HubSpot is capable of integrating with the external APIs required by our CAD configurator to streamline this process. Could HubSpot potentially support API calls or configurations that would allow it to handle this CAD download function more effectively?
Hello everyone.  Has anyone experienced an SSL issue where a cert expired but when updated, HubSpot fails to see the new valid certificate?
Hi all is it possible to create home page in HubSpot with main domain and main-domain/about on wordpress
Like <http://example.com|example.com> on HubSpot and <http://example.com|example.com>/about on Wordpress
Anyone here has done work setting up Sales,Marketing,Service Hub for a debt collection agency? Would really appreciate a few minutes of your time. TIA
